abstract: Federal charges against Jeffry Hill, longtime vineyard manager in Napa Valley, Calif, who founded brand Hill Wine Co in 2012, has shaken trust in the wine-growing region; Hill faces charges of substituting cheaper grapes for Napa cabernet sauvignon that was advertised on his labels; has since ceded control of his business and filed for bankruptcy citing $8 million in debt.
lead_paragraph: Jeffry Hill is accused of passing off wine from surrounding counties as a Napa Valley product and of stealing the grapes of another winery. His company has filed for bankruptcy and is being shut.
